intro: Leandra microphylla, commonly known as the small-leaved leandra, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, ovate leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of rainforests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
